etymology: From Ottoman Turkish سورچمك (sürçmek, “to slip, stumble”), from Proto-Turkic [Term?]. According to Clauson there can hardly be an etymological connection to sürmek (“to rub”) or sürtmek. Cognate to Karakhanid [script needed] (sürçmēk, “to stumble”), Chagatai [script needed] (sürçmek, “to slip, stumble”), Kipchak [Arabic needed] (süçre-, “to stumble”).
